location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Notebook of George Nathaniel Curzon's travels through Persia

physicalDescription.extent: The main body of notes proceeds in approximate chronological order from the front to the rear of the volume; a separate set of notes begins at the rear of the volume and proceeds towards the front.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the inside front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 92; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This volume is a bound notebook with handwritten notes in pencil by George Nathaniel Curzon. The notes, which follow on from an earlier notebook, Mss Eur F112/365, relate to Curzon's travels through Persia in 1889-90. The notes cover the period 25 November 1889 to 2 January 1890 and particularly relate to Curzon's visits to Teheran [Tehran] and Isfahan. For most of the notebook the notes appear in the form of diary entries that are preceded by date headings. Most of the folios have a vertical line drawn down the centre in pencil or ink; these lines do not represent column divisions, as the notes are written across the lines rather than in columns.
